intro: Neoporteria intermedia, commonly known as the yellow vulture's bell, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy texture, while its stems are woody and branched. Neoporteria intermedia is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
